name: arranger
content:
arranger noun [C]
(OF MUSIC)
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone who makes changes to a piece of music so that it can be played in a different way or by a different instrument: The famous jazz musician Duke Ellington was a composer, arranger, and pianist.
More examplesFewer examplesParks is a composer and arranger in his own right.She honed her skills as a musical arranger.The software enables arrangers to play their songs on, say, a keyboard and end up with a fully notated score on the computer.

arranger noun [C]
(ORGANIZER)
someone who plans, prepares for, or organizes something: He was said to be the arranger of the deal.
More examplesFewer examplesThe company is a national arranger of corporate conferences.She is well known as the arranger of celebrity magazine interviews.Borrowers are guided through the process by a mortgage arranger.
